page1.title: In which department would you like to see the impact of AI?
page1.receive: Receive personalized recommendations and a practical action plan.

option1.title: Customer Support
option1.body: Questions focused on support flows, channels and interaction volumes. We'll identify automation opportunities and CRM integration.

option2.title: Analytics & Reporting
option2.body: We'll explore which reports are critical and what data feeds them to prioritize predictive models.

option3.title: Finance
option3.body: We'll focus on revenue forecasting, anomaly detection and cost optimization.

option4.title: Marketing
option4.body: Segmentation, lead scoring and campaign optimization.

option5.title: Operations
option5.body: Process automation and operational efficiency improvements.

option7.title: Product
option7.body: Better understanding of product usage and feature prioritization.

page2.title: What information does your company have on hand?
page2.description: Select up to 2 types of data that you can easily use
page2.note: Data is the foundation of AI's work, which operates based on what it learns from it. The better and more organized your data is, the better the results. It doesn't need to be perfect, but it's important to know what you have available.
